#Text=Massive flooding in China ; over 550 thousand evacuated
#Text=Saturday , June 18 , 2011
#Text=The course of the Yangtze River , China 's largest , from north to south .
#Text=Image : File Upload Bot ( Magnus Manske ) . .
#Text=Heavy June rainfall has forced China to evacuate more than 550,000 people from their homes .
#Text=Massive floods have devastated the central and southern parts of the country , causing rivers to overflow their banks and triggering mudslides .
#Text=The rains follow the worst drought in China in over 50 years , which has decimated crop yields .
#Text=Since June 13 , the damage caused by the rainstorms has led to ...
#Text=the emergency evacuation of 671,200 people to safety .
#Text=—
#Text=China 's Ministry of Civil Affairs

#Text=Overall , 40 rivers have risen above safe limits , stressing dykes and dams including those on China 's largest waterway , the Yangtze River , which is flooding downstream while experiencing a severe drought near its source in the north .
#Text=China 's disaster level has been raised to four , the highest on the scale .

#Text=In a statement on its website on Friday , China 's Ministry of Civil Affairs said , " Since June 13 , the damage caused by the rainstorms has led to ... the emergency evacuation of 671,200 people to safety . "
#Text=The current round of heavy rains began in early June .
#Text=Since then , more than a million and a half people have been displaced in the central and southern regions of the country and at least 168 deaths have been reported .
#Text=Meteorologists in Beijing are predicting more heavy rain in Sichuan , Guizhou , and Zhejiang this weekend .
#Text=[ R]escue boats cannot go through those narrow lanes inside the village .
#Text=A lot of them depend on their relatives rowing small wooden boats to get to them ...
#Text=It is hard to help these people inside there .
#Text=—
#Text=Chinese villager
#Text=The government has mobilized its forces to aid in the massive evacuations .
#Text=According to Reuters , local authorities are distributing a box of instant noodles and a carton of bottled water to those affected by the flood .

#Text=But villagers have reported that survival is difficult , especially for those still trapped by the flood waters in small villages , and distribution of aid is slow , with some not receiving any .
#Text=A villager was quoted by Reuters :
#Text=" To be frank , those rescue boats cannot go through those narrow lanes inside the village .
